intro: Calliandra iselyi, commonly known as the yellow calliandra, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and Central America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive, showy inflorescences that resemble plumes. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in dense, branched clusters, which bloom throughout the growing season. Its leaves are bipinnate, consisting of multiple pairs of small, oval-shaped leaflets. Calliandra iselyi is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant floral display and adaptability to various soil types.
